definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Alphabetic writing in English belonging to the Chinese is hieroglyphs, ways of thinking are different.
sentences.chinese: 英文属于拼音文字而中文是象形文字，思维方式不同。

sentences.english: Chinese characters are an ideograph different from the alphabetic writing.
sentences.chinese: 汉字是一种与拼音文字不同的表意文字。

sentences.english: To apply a Ruby, select at least one character.
sentences.chinese: 要应用“拼音文字”，请至少选定一个字符。

sentences.english: Different from alphabetical languages, the Chinese characters have its unique discipline.
sentences.chinese: 与拼音文字大不相同，汉字具有它独特的规律。

sentences.english: The Chinese writing has its own formational advantages, comparing it with the sound one.
sentences.chinese: 汉字相对于拼音文字而言，具有自己的构形优势。

sentences.english: The man can write alphabetic characters such as China, superb?
sentences.chinese: 那个人能把拼音文字写得像中国汉字这样出神入化？

definition: Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
see 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4]
Vietnam characters (like Chinese characters but native to Vietnam)
